description:
Green Danube: My friend liked the flavor but I couldn't take more than a small sip. Some people will not enjoy this drink. Maybe it's too healthy for me. 

Strawberry Bliss: full of strawberry goodness. Super sweet, I couldn't drink the whole drink in one sitting, took it home and it was just as good 6 hours later.

Enjoyed the visit and the drinks came out quick, even with a long line.
author: Gage S.

description:
Needed some juice and I am not going to lie, their juice is refreshing and that was the first time I went. The second time I went for a quick work meeting I tried the quiche and I wouldn't recommend it, it tasted water down and funny. But also if you are trying to use their wifi you have to pay for it which I thought was funny? Why aren't they able to offer free wifi for their customers who are purchasing goods from them?

If you are here I would say try their juice, but this is not a good place to get some work done or food.
author: Yenni H.

description:
Minimum $5 charge for credit card

Such a cute coffee spot. It's small and cozy, but great for catching up with a friend in a relaxing atmosphere. There's plenty of natural light, chairs are pretty comfortable, and there is also outdoor seating. There are people who do bring their laptops here, but be warned that they charge $2 for WiFi for every 2 hours.

I ordered the chai latte and it came in a mason jar with cinnamon sprinkled on top. It was pretty good and generous portion. I'd come again to try their food!
author: Lillian T.

description:
Cute (check out the artwork on their tabletops - each has a different theme) and cozy local spot that makes AMAZING Mexican Hot Chocolate!  I love coming by to grab a cup to go and then go for a nice, long walk.

Would also recommend their avocado toast (it's topped with cucumbers and chili flakes) and Greek yogurt (delicious when you add a dollop of honey).
author: Sheila C.

description:
Super tiny but charming spot, it reminds me of Haight & Ashbury Street hipster rather than this part of town. 

Neatly chalk handwritten menu, salad, sandwich ($10-$15), coffee ($3-$7), fresh juice, smoothies ($6-$8).

Mirrors, books, antiques and rusty looking furnitures and interior designs, comfy couch, tiny table, tightly packed spot, and no privacy during lunch time! It's good to grab and go or coming in on off-peak hours. 

Good Soy Latte, good fresh juice/veggies, very nice cashier.

$2 PAID WiFi which they gave you 2 hrs of WiFi, it was super SLOW & SPOTTY. Disappointed, after spending  almost $20 on drinks. I used my LTE instead, left after 45 mins to Starbucks to a more reliable internet for work!
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
Cons: Its a bit dirty and they charge $2 for wifi
Pros: patron's diaries, books, large menu, lively
author: Aaron C.

description:
On a cold blustery SF afternoon I wanted nothing else but a warm drink to hug me close until I could get back home. And so, I poked into Blue Danube seeing it was bustling with people and ordered myself a cappuccino to go.

My drink was delivered quick and I thought it was pretty good for a to go cappuccino. Foam held strong and espresso wasn't too bitter. Drink was delivered piping hot which was also excellent as I continued along inner richmond.

My only gripe, if anything, was the lack of room to maneuver inside. There was hardly any standing room while I waited for my drink. All available tables were taken so I had to stand awkwardly in the hallway which was full of employees trying to go back and forth.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
+: coffee and food are good

-: They charge $2.00 for wi-fi. Slowest internet speed of any cafe.
author: Jon H.

description:
Come here to chill with friends. It's definitely a cute place to hang out. Not so great if you want to use their wifi. There is no free wifi at this coffee house. 

I came here to work one day, and I did enjoy the atmosphere. Although, it could get distracting when it gets crowded or if you're facing the street, since it's on Clement where there's always pedestrians and cars going by. 

Since it was later in the day, I wasn't in the mood for coffee. I was however hungry so I ordered their quesadilla. Their quesadilla was alright. I mean, who can mess up a tortilla with just cheese filling? It comes with a side of salsa, side of sour cream, and several slices of avocado.
author: Erica M.

description:
Awesome spot to grab a cup of coffee/wine/beer/kombucha, etc and do some work :) It's located in inner richmond, and on a nice day they open up the windows so we can enjoy the fresh air. 

My friends and I went on an extremely nice day, and we got to sit right next to the seats with open windows. I ordered the kombucha on tap, and it was pomegranate lemonade that day. Was delicious! There is a number of food items as well for those that want a good meal.

It's a great spot to do work, but unfortunately wi-fi is $2. So make sure to bring some non-wifi related work :) It gets pretty busy in the morning but dies down during the afternoon. The space is cozy, so you might have to wait for a spot depending on what time you get there.
author: Jackie C.

description:
I live near this cafe and have passed by it more times than I can count. I finally checked it out to get some work done, and it's a nice classic, local coffee shop. Prices are fairly reasonable and staff is very friendly.
As far as I know you have to pay for wifi by the hour, which is a downside. But it's a nice place to chill out or to get some light tasks done.
author: Stirling H.

description: Trying to not be irritated while writing this review.  Yes my breakfast bagel (sesame bagel, tomato, scrambled eggs, & bacon) was hot and delicious and my decaf white mocha was hot and yummy too.   Which I chose to eat in.  What irritated me was that I ordered a slice of carrot cake in a to go box too.  I wanted to just have a couple of bites with my breakfast while there.  They helped like 10 people after I placed my order and even when I was done eating they STILL didn't get to box my carrot cake slice.  Ugh.  Yes, I am bitching because I was really looking forward to having a couple of bites there.  Since I didn't eat the other half of my breakfast bagel I went up to the counter and needed a box for it.  It was only then that he boxed up my cake slice.  Seriously?
author: Emy B.

description: The coffee and food are ok, and the ambiance being right on Clement is nice I guess... but are you seriously going to charge me $2 to get on wifi when you just sold me a $5 latte? Its not 1999. There are equally good coffee places within a few blocks' distance where I can work without having to tether to an unreliable mobile connection.
author: Arthur V.

description:
Size: medium cup looks like a small but for $4.75
Taste: my mocha tastes more of hot water than coffee
Time: too a while, I thought they forgot and had to go check
Space: looks nice from the outside, really cramped inside
WiFi: I heard they charge $ so haven't tried using it
Price: a bit overpriced as I have had better coffee down the street for less

Conclusion: go to Toy Boat down the street and save yourself some time writing an unhappy review for this place on Yelp like I am doing. :/
author: T L.

description: Coffee is good but it's a super small place and they have maximized space by placing tables literally an inch apart so you can hear your neighbor breathing. Also, they charge for WiFi use even AFTER making a purchase. Lastly, it feels like a sauna in there with the windows open. Bleeds and oozes hipster. You're welcome :)
author: Parasto S.

description:
It is Easter Sunday and so hard to find a breakfast place that is not closed or is not packed with people in line for Easter brunch!! Found Blue Danube through the YELP search. Thank you!!

A small and unique coffee shop that serves breakfast and lunch with variety of choices; baked goods, granola, wraps for breakfast or salad and sandwiches if you want to have a healthy lunch. 

The place us interesting artwork and inviting seating areas (a couple of couches). Would have loved to hang out here longer if I was not in a rush to go to the airport!! Ordered latte and hot apple cider for drinks. Granola with yogurt and the California breakfast wrap. The coffee wasn't as hot as I wanted it to be and should have asked for extra hot. Otherwise it was great flavor. The granola with banana/berry and yogurt was delicious and a filling choice for breakfast. Loved a taste of the wrap that hubby was having as well.

All in all, a cute neighborhood gem of a coffee shop. Should not forget the friendly and helpful staff...
author: Mehrnaz H.

description:
Stopped by here after an amazing meal at Burma Superstar just to grab my daily cold brew as I was making my way through the coffee shops of the SF area. The cold brew was definitely strong and had a nice kick to it. My only reservation was that the cold brew itself may have been almost a little too strong in my opinion. I prefer my coffee drinks to have that wonderful roasted coffee bean delight to it and I just felt like this was just a little bit overly acidic for my own liking.

Nonetheless, really kind staff and nice place to go if you just need something to sip on for the day. Would be kind of nice if they also didn't charge you for Wifi as well... I mean come on now
author: Michael C.

description: They charge you for wifi. Wtf. justify it however you want but that's ridiculous. Probably will never come here again.
author: Kaizer D.

description: Absolutely amazing. Blue Danube has everything you could possibly want. The California Wrap is amazing. The Hulk, Purple Rain, and Strawberry Bliss smoothies are fantastic. Their coffee is delicious. The atmosphere is wonderful. I highly recommend Blue Danube. You will not be disappointed.
author: Erin D.

description: Love this little Inner Richmond find! Great smoothies, but spotty WiFi. The people are friendly and it's a great spot to hang out.
author: Nabiha J.

description:
There are about 20 tables for 2 persons.
Each table is​ set close, but do not feel so crowded​.

The place is great ​if you want to stop by during browsing around the ​clement street and if you want to keep yourself in your mind.
There is wifi service for 2 dollars, but you can connect xfinity also.

The taste of coffee is great. I like not sour but deep taste.
A cup of the ​small size of house coffee costs 2 dollars.

You can grab good sandwiches also.

If I want to come around this area, I will come here again.
author: Mitsuho S.

description:
Good drinks, but slow service and high cost knock it down a few stars. I'd really give a 2.5/5.
Fiancee got a medium iced latte that must have barely brushed 10 oz. I got a cappuccino that was 8oz and was 4 dollars- about normal price for SF. The deal-breaker, though, was an avocado toast that cost SEVEN dollars and took way too long to come out. It was tasty, and the cucumbers were a nice touch, but 7 dollars and a long wait were not worth it. Though it didn't apply to us, they also charge for Wifi.
author: Samir K.

description: This place couldn't be any cuter, and the fact that they have kombucha on tap earns them bonus points. If you're looking for a funky little study spot or a place to meet up with friends over some healthy breakfast (or delicious cake), Blue Danube is a good choice. They have a pretty expansive menu for such a small shop -- Everything from breakfast sandwiches & lunch plates to smoothies, pastries and dessert. Definitely gets my nod of approval!
author: Shannon F.

description: Wanted to like this spot, but the coffee was mediocre and the staff was extremely condescending to my mother.  We get it - people are probably jerks about coffee, but exercising your fresh roasted organic free trade demons on my well-intentioned mother who was genuinely confused during an order gets you a black eye in the customer service department.  Multiple options for coffee in the neighborhood and a mudbutt attitude doesn't leave many reasons to give you repeat business.
author: Cameron T.

description: Neighborhood vibes rule in this community cafe that captures the imagination of everyone who's dreamed of owning their own cafe one day. Great big cups of coffee for $2.50. A few downsides: minimum card payment and no free WiFi - but the upsides completely outweigh these couple issues.
author: James G.

description:
This is my go to coffee spot in the Richmond. A good selection of breakfast and lunch items to go along with your latte or Mexican hot chocolate. 

The staff is friendly and always helpful. They provide the service you expect from a small business  in a city that is being consumed by bland chains like Blue Bottle or Starbucks. 

Take the time and support small business and enjoy this neighborhood coffee spot.
author: Rob M.

description: This place was perfect for grabbing a small bite (pita melt or something), a cup of mint mocha, and get some work done. I noticed they charged for WiFi though which was kind of lame, but I didn't really need it that night so it was fine for me. Would definitely recommend; especially because it is open a little later than most coffee places!
author: Kassie E.

description:
In the area for breakfast and decided to stop in to try Blue Danube.  Eccentric and a little kitschy decor.  I like the colorful cartoon/superheros tables.  Too bad I had made my coffee the morning we came so didn't get to try their coffee.  
We ordered the oatmeal with milk and a Mediterranean wrap for breakfast.  Both were tasty and satisfying.  Oatmeal came with fresh berries and the milk was just right temp and frothy.  Wrap was just as good.  I like all the veggies in it especially the artichoke and sun-dried tomatoes.  
Great neighborhood coffeehouse.
author: Naty D.

description:
Came here to study with two other people. I would say as a study spot this is a 3/5. 
Pros: Easy to find seating (we went Saturday afternoon) and there were other people working so it doesn't seem like they shoo people away. We stayed about 4 hours
Cons: Chairs and tables aren't that comfortable, moderate noise (manageable with earplugs / headphones), dim lighting once sun sets, cold

Purple rain smoothie: I don't usually like smoothies too sweet but this flavor was just too plain 2/5
Quesadilla: pretty tasty with decent amount of toppings and price point was okay 4/5
author: Anna N.

description:
Thank you, Yelp! I've discovered a cool coffee shop that serves Mexican Hot Chocolate alongside adult beverages and smoothies. Its a pretty unique menu you got here.

I have only tried the hot chocolate and their dirty Chai Latte, bit I am already a fan. Prices are reasonable for the quality of the drinks. I think a Small is 12 oz. and the Large is 16 oz. 

Parking can be tricky since this place is located on a busy part of Clement, where there are tons of restaurants and businesses. Be patient or try to park further away in the residential area.
author: May W.

description: This place is so cool!!! Great vibes on clement street. I got an iced pourover with almond milk and a little pumpkin syrup and it is so tasty. Love it here! They also have a nice looking food menu and vegan cookies!!!
author: Emily H.

description: I like this place!! Really good sandwiches, juices, smoothies and icoffee. Prices are a little steep, that's why I'm giving 4 stars, but overall a nice relaxed atmosphere with nice workers. Haven't had a bad encounter yet!
author: Daniella J.

description: Perfect Inner Richmond spot to grab a simple bite or adult beverage. Clean, relaxed and never overly crowded in the heart of reassurance row. Anchor Steam on tap - a reasonable $6
author: Nick S.

description: I love this place! I spend a lot of time writing and I always look for the right place. This coffee shop has great coffee and smoothies and the music is not too loud. I haven't tried any of their food so I can't say much but it's definitely a great study place. The only issue is it's tiny and tables are squished together. Since I do work alone it's not much of an issue but I don't recommend it for study groups. Also it's in a location that's really inconvenient for me but that's just a personal issue. I spend most of my time downtown or on my college campus but I still like making the trip for the open and comfortable environment!
author: Jenny B.

description: This place used to be a perfect piece of SF, now it's overpriced to the highest degree. Bagel with egg and cheese is almost $6 and just a bad bagel with bad eggs and too much cheese. An 8 oz coffee for here is $2 and an additional $2 charge for WIFI! Id skip it and go to Noah's bagels for better quality.
author: Sarah T.

description: Stopped in to grab a coffee on my way home from lunch. Very cozy and colorful inside. Ordered a soy double shot Mexican Mocha. Tasty, not overly sweet. My only complaint is that it was a bit pricey. Over $7, for what looks like about a 16 ounce cup. I'll definitely return for lunch sometime. The food menu sounds tasty, as well as their fresh juices.
author: Yvonne S.

description:
I was meeting up a friend and decided to try this place. There was a lot of seating inside, but I hear the biggest complaint for everyone being the wifi.... hope they fix that soon!

I ordered an iced coffee which was just okay, but the part the really annoyed me were the flies!!! They were everywhere and really annoying.
author: Carrie L.

description: Probably one of the best lattes I have ever had. Adorable environment and great options. Affordable for the area too!
author: Carla C.

description:
The drinks are alright. Food is VERY OK.... this place grosses me out bc there are tons of flies everywhere. Every time I've eaten here I am swatting flies out of my face and away from my food. The food is way over priced for what it is and the guy charges for wifi. 

Last time I came they gave me a BLTA with like black avocado on it.
author: Gabby O.

description: Amazing Soy Cappuccino, wow! The guys working there are amazing! Cool, calm, and collected. Dreaming of my next cappuccino from there. So frothy.  Such a cute place too.
author: Alexis C.

description: I have had some of my best iced white mochas here!! Ham and cheese croissant fills you up well. Interior is a little funny, though.
author: Albert N.

description:
After being closed for quite some time, they reopened, to large price hikes. I went in and got a latte and was charged .50 more than it said on the menu board. I pointed this out and was told the price was for a medium, when they clearly had prices listed for small, medium and large, and I was being charged more than the large. And it was a 12 oz cup. I don't understand how that all worked, but I will definitely not be coming back. 

2 stars because they were in Chance on Hulu and that's pretty cool. Otherwise, I'm not interested in overpaying.
author: Venus S.

description:
$2 for 2 hours of high speed wifi 
(Even with purchase)

I did find that a little weird, most coffee places I have been to offers free wifi with purchase. The high speed, great customer service, and different choices of drinks make up for it. The 1st access code they gave me didn't work but they gladly issued me another one. 

I got a small cold brew coffee ($4) it was more on the dark roast/bitter side than light roast/ acidic sour side. Not bad not bad. 

This is a really nice place to get some work done! A lot of seating available inside and outside. They do play some back ground music (not too loud) and there is some chattering going on. I'm currently staring at another customer's fancy looking cheese and cracker platter. Looks delicious!
author: Nancy C.

description: Love the Blue Danube volumes. Check out this place to read what random strangers decided to share over the years in a collection of 40 or so volumes.
author: Yash D.

description:
Been here three times early morning. 
Love the ambience, it's a cool spot to hang out. 
Coffee and breakfast is actually okay for me. Maybe I'm being picky but quality of ingredients isn't the best.
author: Claire J.

description: This cafe has been here forever! When cafes where places you could go sit, write, read and just be, without all the hype and feeling like you need to get your coffee or whatever and get out
author: Valerie D.

description:
Like many people, I'm sure, we stopped in while waiting for a table at Burma Superstar. Everything was just fine; nothing was spectacular.

It is important that they are definitely NOT catering to the "work from a coffee shop" crowd...don't come with your laptop! Wifi is $2/2h and they have a TV on playing sports...would be pretty difficult for me to concentrate if I was trying to get things done. 

The teas we got were fine. Their brand of choice is Mighty Leaf Tea, so if you are a tea drinker, you know exactly what you are getting. Problem is they gave us hot water in MASSIVE mugs (16+ oz?). I could not steep the tea long enough to get the correct flavor out...make sure you ask for a smaller cup if dining in!

I appreciate hands off service at a coffee shop, so no complaints there. I also liked the comic book themed table art!
author: John A.

description: San Francisco the way it used to be. Relaxed atmosphere, diverse crowd, no attitude, good drinks and food.
author: Emmanuel L.

description:
My boyfriend lives just a block down from here so I end up stopping for breakfast here pretty often. The cold brew is delicious and the breakfast bagel, wraps and smoothies are also tasty. 
It's very cute, welcoming and never seems too packed. My one complaint is often when I go up to order employees are making a coffee or something and don't acknowledge me. I really don't mind waiting a moment while they catch up on orders but a quick 'hello, I'll be with you in one moment' would really make a difference to me. I feel sort of sad and awkward just waiting there looking lost until they are ready to take my order.
author: Michelle D.

description: Asking extra money for wifi? Isn't it enough paying for your average sandwiches and coffee? This gotta be a joke....Don't even bother yourself sitting this greedy place and wasting your time. First and last time here.
author: Osman K.

description: Good coffee. I grabbed a breakfast sandwich while I was there. Pretty average for SF prices. Good atmosphere. I was able to sip my coffee and read for awhile. My friend recommend it to me and I wasn't disappointed.
author: Amanda I.

description: I like the local, cozy feel but their coffee and chai lattes are simply not good!  The chai I got was overpowered with ginger.  It was undrinkable.  Also the shop is dirty.  Baristas are nice.
author: Chelsea D.

description: Great selection. Got a couple of the juices which I appreciate weren't too cold. Just freshly made. Recommend the jolly rancher that wasn't too sweet. Great funky vibe. Will be back
author: Michelle T.

description:
This place would be described in a 1960's movie script as a "kooky, hippie cafe" and then Goldie Hawn would walk in and start doing the frug. That's what it looks like in here in 2014, a bit boho thrown together with thrift shop finds to evoke something that makes you think Joni Mitchell will be sitting on the church bench strumming "Chelsea Morning" on her guitar (photo: http://bit.ly/1wZsjyj). The staff has that loosey-goosey feeling, too, and that's a good thing, but the customers not so much as it appears to be a caffeinated single ladies hangout on a Saturday morning. Put a ring on it. Or wipe it off the table, will ya? Some very uptight people with very bad table manners hang out here.

They serve standard cafe fare - salads, sandwiches, small breakfasts - and of course, coffee and tea. I was waiting for my car to be ready, so I went for a $3.85 Double Chai Tea (photo: http://bit.ly/1rQcNzr). Finding a single table was not as impossible as I thought it was going to be, and I sat across from a couple of women who were recapping their lackluster dating lives in excruciating detail. It made me wish I had earbuds, double-stuffed Q-tips, anything to make the whining, estrogen-fueled entitlement stop. But I could still see myself coming back on a leisurely afternoon ordering an $8.95 Veggie Avocado Sandwich and a $4.85 Funky Monkey Smoothie with peanut butter, banana and chocolate. That does sound good, doesn't it?

CHAI - 4 stars...well turned and it hit the spot on a slow Saturday morning
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...hippy-dippy with a boho vibe that would not be out of lace in Greenwich Village circa 1963
SERVICE - 4 stars...likable staff here
TOTAL - 4 stars...the kind of coffee spot that I wish was in my 'hood instead of all the Starbucks knockoffs
author: Ed U.

description: They had nice drinks on tap. Don't go here for wifi though. $2 charge for the slowest bandwidth I've seen a business offer since I was in high school. Either ditch the $2 charge or get state of the art NSA-level bandwidth, otherwise it's completely pointless to come here to get any work done.
author: Charlie T.

description: Such friendly service and the coziest atmosphere to read and chill for a sec! Coffee was okay, a bit cold, and cash only for paying under 5$! But I sat here for hours lost in a book and it felt like the perfect place. Will come again!
author: Lara H.

description: I've been here a few times and it's always just been okay. But after my $13 dollar danube salad drenched and soggy in dressing, and with hard unedible bread, and my $5 dollar SMALL iced vanilla latte I could have made better myself, I think I'll spend my money elsewhere next time for a subpar lunch. Not to mention the woman at the cashier was less than friendly and the salad took way longer than it should have...
author: Kate M.

description: Fresh juices, smoothies, coffee, breakfast sandwiches and wifi. Love this neighborhood coffee shop!
author: Reishi A.

description: If anything related to it's name, this is a tea house and not a coffee house. In fact having 200+ items on the menu makes this more of a general food locale, where coffee seems more like an afterthought!
author: Alex P.

description: The ambiance here is lovely, but I wish I would have known that they charged for wifi before I bought my $4 small iced coffee. I can imagine coming here if I wanted to disconnect and read, but as I have a lot of work to do, and am out of cash, this is majorly inconvenient and I'll now have to go elsewhere, and buy another coffee, just to take care of what I need to.
author: Elise S.

description: I expect good service from an expensive place like Blue Danube. I live in the neighborhood and have never had such a bad experience with a local coffee house until today. We went in there at 8:25am on a Saturday morning. It wasn't busy at all. It took us close to 30 minutes to get 2 large lattes and a breakfast bagel, a breakfast wrap, and a plain bagel to go. I'm also so irritated that the breakfast sandwich was an open sandwich. No where on the menu did it say that! It was also supposed to come with a fruit cup, which wasn't in my box. This breakfast sandwich cost me $9. We could have spent the same amount at The Richfield for example and get much better service and more food. Never coming back here again. The worst!!!
author: Minna F.

description: I live locally so I would consider this one of my go-to's for breakfast or a coffee on the weekend. I would definitely recommend the refresher juice and the quesadillas. It's a retro looking cafe, with a nice atmosphere. If you're a standard SF techie looking to work for the day this is the WRONG place as you have to pay for wifi. Go here for a catch up with your friends!
author: Holly M.

description: Amazing so happy I came here for breakfast! Got a cold brew coffee and breakfast bagel. great outdoor seating
author: Courtney S.

description: So wifi is $2 for 2 hours and I expected it to be kinda fast since I was paying for wifi on top of the coffee (which is overpriced like everything else here) but alas the wifi is terribly slow. Also, $12 sandwiches, 12. You can go a couple blocks down to Geary and get something at Lou's for a great price! Staff wasn't friendly at all either. Only reason why I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 is because the vibe is kinda cool. If you wanna sit down and get work done here, would NOT recommend.
author: Ivan S.

description:
Nice, quaint little coffee shop. Love the atmosphere...very cozy on a cold SF night.
I got the Mexican Hot Chocolate. Very interesting. 

Served warm & full of chocolate goodness with a hint of cinnamon spice. Unfortunately, they charge $2 for WiFi. Docked one star there...

Nice cafe though.
author: Ralph N.

description: Great for vegetarians!! I always get the veggie avocado sandwich and it's super good! Service is good. the atmosphere is nice and relaxing
author: Shanna R.

description: I quirky little coffee shop with prices on par with what was expected. I had a smooth with espresso and it was heavenly. My friend had a above average cappuccino. Worth checking out!
author: Jake M.

description: They do take credit cards but there's a minimum charge. The large coffee size is literally only 12oz though :/. But overall love the coffee here when I used to live in inner Richmond.
author: Ti I.

description: Since they reopened I have gone down the list of sandwiches, salads and juices and each more impressive then the last! Service is polite and spectacular.  I am on route to try yet another new menu item.
author: Keeley S.

description: The coffee shop is aesthetically pleasing - it looks like a nice place to relax. However, there are a few concerning things to consider before coming here. Firstly, the staff was not very friendly and they seemed to be annoyed while working. Also, wifi is not free and you have to pay a fee to use it (not ideal if you're looking to study, work, etc). The latte I ordered was good but another person in my party ordered a London fog and the barista forgot to add vanilla syrup (only realized this once we left). Overall, I would recommend going elsewhere for better drinks and more personable staff. The ambiance was not ideal!
author: Michaele Francesco C.

description: Pretty a-okay cafe. Friendly staff, comfortable ambiance. The greek yogurt was mediocre & pricey for what it was. The cappuccino was just alright. Down to try their sandwiches next time and maybe try their latte, otherwise just an ordinary coffee shop. I had great company though and sat on the "deck"!
author: Anna S.

description: I love this cozy little cafe tucked away in the Richmond district. The decor is cute and eclectic. They have all sorts of drinks, smoothies, sandwiches, and little bites. I love their Mexican hot chocolate as it has just the right amount of cinnamon and chocolate. Their sandwiches are pretty good as well; they have fresh ingredients and come with a side salad. My favorite is their blt. The vibe is relaxed and it's great to come here with friends just to enjoy.
author: Beth G.

description: 1980 called, they are looking for their cafe. Come on Clement Street, you can do better! Decor is terrible. Food is over salted. They charge for wi-fi and service is bad. Let's go and tear this place down and open up a contemporary establishment with awesome coffee, food, and some   simple, sleek design. Maybe some cool art from Park Life? This is a disgrace.
author: Nicole B.

description: Great coffee, friendly service, and good food! Plenty of seating and the menu ranges from coffee to smoothies to sandwiches, breakfast and salads.
author: Alexander T.

description:
Fuck Walt Disney.  Greatest place on Earth.

One must elaborate or else one's review is relegated to "Tips."  The food is delicious and healthy and the coffee is great and the music is wonderful and it smells good and everything inside of this cafe is pretty.  Sometimes when you are sitting there reading and drinking one their quite nice, $6 glasses of wine, a man will buy you Oreos.  Anyone who rates Blue Danube less than 5 stars is a fool and should not be trusted.  If the Danube salad is not one of the five best salads you've ever had, you can charge me for it on Venmo
author: Josh K.

description:
$2 for 2 hours of wifi - SLOW WIFI. 

The decor of this place is lovely and the the location is super chill. With couches, bar stools against a mirrored wall, and plenty of tables, there is a spot for anyone from group projects to someone doing work on their laptop. 

The Purple Rain smoothie was delicious even though the poppy seeds were congregating in the gaps of my teeth. No biggie.

I gave this place 2 stars for their $2 for 2 hours of wifi. This was the first place I've visited and spent a good $10 for a smoothie and a bag of chips and have to pay extra for wifi! 

What's worse was the wifi was slow! Like, I couldn't load Twitter or Facebook and that's totally not acceptable given I only had two hours to get work done. I know, I shouldn't be on social media when there's a timer on my connection but, when I do start, I can't sit and wait for pages to load while I'm on the clock!
author: John C.

description:
Wow, good people do exist, and I appreciate the staff at Blue Danube for being honest citizens.  I stopped in for a latte to go before heading over to my nail appointment at the new Nail Art House, and in the process of ordering and needing to make my appointment, I left a bag of Christmas shopping in the cafe.  I realized about an hour later that I had forgotten my bag, called the shop, and they informed me that they had put it behind the counter and would hold it for me.  When I came back to pick it up, everything there was in the bag, and had placed it behind their counter.

I definitely enjoy the cafe itself, it's definitely got the "neighborhood cafe" feel to it, and there were locals hanging out on their laptops or having brunch when I was there.  I asked for a double latte, which was $3.60 and came in a fairly large cup.  Their sitting area outside would be nice when it's warmer out, and it's definitely a good place to start if you're heading to the Farmers Market on Clement on Sundays or waiting in line for Burma Superstar which is across the street.

They're cash only, so come ready with paper.  Thanks again Blue Danube, I totally appreciate everything!
author: Lisa I.

description:
My baby has come back to me.

Unspecified "plumbing issues" forced this neighborhood staple to shut its doors for a gut-wrenching amount of time, but praise the high heavens because Blue Danube is finally back. I love this cafe for myriad reasons, but it cemented itself into my heart through pure nostalgia. 

After years of running around the corner to grab a morning smoothie or a late night latte, losing my go-to for such a long time hurt. A lot. I still remember sitting at Blue Danube in college, drinking espresso and frantically writing papers, and those memories will never fade. That's why I'm ready to move forward in my relationship with this eclectic coffee house and nothing's going to stop me come hell or high water. 

This place feels like home, and I'm never letting go.
author: Cecelia Y.

description: Excellent veggie sandwich. We also had  coffee - capacinno which was great. Spent about $20. Well worth it.
author: Suresh S.

description:
Very yummy salad. Semi-rude service. 

It's an OK combo for the price. :)
author: Cori N.

description: Unfortunately I visited this cafe during the power outage but I can say that the owner has gotten a good sense of humor and totally chill.  Love the little cafe down to earth ambiance.  They got a good decent variety of food choices for breakfast and lunch.  Will be back to try out their coffee.
author: Paris F.

description:
Hooray, Blue Danube is finally open again!
I went yesterday to do some studying. It was very nice, light and airy (but still more or less the same as before!). They were giving out free coffee and tea which was a very nice gesture.
People kept coming in to welcome them back, it felt very nice and community-oriented.
Welcome back, Blue Danube!
author: Rachel M.

description:
Lesson learned. Any & all food I get here will henceforth be ordered face-to-face, mano y mano, i.e., not over the phone.

I called ahead for a salad, and the first thing I asked for was "no cheese". What was in my salad? Cheese. The second thing that came up was whether I wanted beef and / or beets. The two together would cost extra, so I opted for just beef. What was in my salad? Beets. No beef.

The cashier might as well have shook my hand with an electric buzzer, trick squirt flowered me in the face, black eye telescoped me, or pulled any other variety of practical jokes... like the ol' jumping dollar gag. Funny how my $6.95 salad and $3.50 juice jumped up to $15.23 total. No receipt. I still tipped on top of that.

I ended up anger-eating #uglybetty about 1/3 of the salad before the effthis factor took charge and had me donate the remainder to compost.

Stuff I've ordered in-person and eaten on-site has been drama-free, though. Remember to add to the customer doodle books.
author: Dan B.

description:
The best reason to choose Blue Danube is the "room". Go here for the atmosphere.

Added 5/18/15: Been closed for a month, perhaps several due to alleged plumbing work (sign in window).
author: Chuck G.

description: Decent coffee, but they charge $2 an hour for Wifi. That would be ok but the Wifi connection is pathetically slow!
author: Neal A.

description: I went here because of the good reviews. The ambiance is pleasant, and there is a little bookshelf. Bur who charges two dollars to use the Wi-Fi? I'm outta here.
author: Richard T.

description: Neat work space/reading spot with wifi and a fair amount of power outlets and some tasty juices. I had a refreshing blend of apple, mint, and cucumber which I enjoyed quite a bit. The food looks pretty solid too. I'd def come back.
author: Misha T.

description:
Pretty sweet coffee shop. I've seen this place quite a bit whenever I stop around Clement St for food but finally got the chance to go in and actually give the coffee a try one day. I got the mint mocha. They do have a $5 credit card minimum. When I went on a Saturday afternoon, I was pretty surprised to see the place packed to the brim. Pretty typical coffee shop folks--you got people writing, reading, working, playing games, etc. It's just a generally chill atmosphere. My mint mocha was pretty delicious and made pretty quickly which I appreciated. They also sell juices, smoothies, savory food items, etc. Anyways lots of good stuff and a pretty chill vibe and atmosphere. 

tldr; nice little cafe that serves some pretty good coffee. good vibes
author: Jasmine X.

description:
The food here is really good! I had a sandwich and it came with a side salad and everything was great. When you walk in it kind of seems like you just walked onto the set of Friends. Overall a really great atmosphere and I was stoked to make this my new go-to. However, they charge something like 2 dollars to use the wi-fi for 1.5 hrs and you are kicked off. Really? The charge caught me off guard. If I am at a coffee shop working on stuff it will usually be longer than 1.5 hours and I will absolutely need internet. Long story short I wanted to stay, but had to leave because I didn't want to keep paying for wifi access. 

If you don't rely on the wifi then I would absolutely recommend spending some time here. There are different couches and chairs and lots of cool stuff to look at all around.
author: Thielson D.

description:
One of the best things about SF? The many coffee shops. 
Blue Danube is a chill cafe where people can hangout, converse, study, work, etc. you can basically live there for a day. They have couches that are comfortable and tables if you're looking to concentrate.

Most cafés have the regular bagels and sandwiches. What I really like about this place is from the small eats menu: the pita melt. It's a toasted pita, with humus and cheese. So simple, but so good!
author: Mica C.

description: I have never written a Yelp review before, but being fairly reliant on yelp myself and seeing the poor snobby reviews on here inspired me to share my disagreement. Blue Danube is one of the best and one of the last few places I call a genuine San Francisco coffee shop.It has good food, delicious fresh squeezed juices, and the coffee is certainly good enough for me as a coffee snob.
author: Alicia K.

description:
This was a random place given the location, but the blueberry pie was the best blueberry pie I've tasted in a while. It was smooth, with a great blend of tart and sweet.
The inside tart was juicy. The outside was crumbly. There was great texture.
I also got the Mexican hot chocolate, as it was voted as good. The cups are huge!! Probably 2 cups of hot chocolate worth.
The total came to $5 ish, so it was a good deal.
I give it 4 stars for location and spotty wifi.
author: Lina H.

description: Favorite cafe on Clement. Delicious chai, good coffee, Cobb salad for the win AND, it's so cute and cozy inside :) SO happy they are back open- I missed them!
author: Alicia L.

description: I take exception to calling this a cafe or coffee house, because it's not anymore.  It's more like a restaurant or bar where people go for first dates or to meet friends. I came here to get some work done - you know, the kind of thing you can do in a coffee house - but the wifi was $2 and I couldn't focus over the incessant annoying chatter of the patrons. Never going here again.
author: Mark W.

description:
Are you guys ever gonna re-open? Seems like it's been almost 6 months now. 

Starting to get concerned it's lights out for one of my favorite neighborhood cafes. :-/
author: Andrew C.

description:
For what I was looking for at the time, Blue Danube didn't fit my bill. I was sad. Basically, I needed a place where I could work for the afternoon on a project, with internet, and food. Ideally, with all-day parking. Already, the parking is an issue because in the immediate area, there's only 2 hour parking (meter and non-meter). Fail. I was tired and hungry when I got here, so just decided to work for a few hours, until my parking time was up. 

The food here...was just okay. Had a grilled chicken sandwich, which came with a side of mixed green salad. It was ok. Flavors were good, but it wasn't as good as it could be. For some reason, my sandwich was both crispy and soggy...they pressed it panini-style, but had a really soggy tomato in there...which meant that my sandwich was soggy on the bottom. Because. They put the soggy stuff on the bottom. o.O Sandwich fail!

The wifi here is crap. For the $2/hour I paid, I feel like I should have gotten quality wifi. I mean, it didn't seem like the others here were using THAT much internet. I loaded google docs, which took forever. Tried google street view for my next locale, and I couldn't get the maps to load at all. It was a blurry mess. 

The coffee...because I'm an addict, was okay. It's not the best coffee you'll get, but it's solid. This might be a good place to meet up with someone and catch up, but definitely not good to study or work from. 

Oh. Also. When you come in/go out, don't forget to shut the door. It's not an auto-shut, and since it was RAINING the day I came, all the jerks leaving the door open was just inviting water and cold to come in. NOT COOL, MAN!!
author: Lily W.

description: I came here to catch up with some old friends and am glad we chose Blue Danube as the spot for our reunion. This place has a great low-key, artsy vibe and was super comfy cozy on a rainy afternoon. They have a good selection of beers on tap, and I was particularly fond of the Tell Tale Tart by Boulevard brewing. My friends all got mexican hot chocolates which were good, but we all agreed that we would prefer a smaller cup of cocoa with a more intense chocolatey flavor. But the service was great and they offered to remake the cocoa. If I'm in the area I would definitely return.
author: Malini K.

description:
Only detractor is the wifi. Don't come here if you want to do work that requires the internet. Not only is the wifi either extremely slow or not available at all, they make you pay for it ($2, but still).

If you're looking for a spot to read, write, or ponder amidst good bites, this place is perfect. Check out the community journals nestled into the bookcase in the back right. Fascinating blips of the inner thoughts and desires of anonymous wanderers.
author: Liam M.

description: This is the sort of place that you love sitting at for a cup of tea or coffee and a book. The food is a little overpriced for what you get (I ordered their Breakfast Fiesta and wasn't too impressed), but I guess the decor makes up for it! Ample sunlight floods the space and well as chalkboard menus and art work. Perfect for a relaxing day if you're not too hungry or have some time to kill.
author: Joseph H.

description:
Bought the Hulk smoothie (which the barista kindly switched bananas out for strawberries )on a Wednesday at 12:30. Wasn't crowded at all, but had about 4-5 parties (mostly parties of 1) so it wasn't awkwardly quiet. 

They've got a great hot meal menu (breakfast wraps, parfait, French toast, salads, sandwiches, bagels), smoothies, fresh squeezed juices, coffee (of course!), and snacks. 

Great table spacing, fairly spacious, restroom in the back, fun tables, lots of outlets, big open window. It's just lovely. Can't wait to come back and study here!
author: Alice R.

description: $2to use WiFi.... That's all I have to say, bought hot chocolate,  tea and bottle water.  And $2 for Internet???
author: SFoodie P.

description:
Dropped by just for the Mexican hot chocolate right before closing (10pm) a few days ago. Lots of spices, but not particularly *spicy* - more sweet than I preferred, but maybe that was because I got marshmallows? 

Cashier was friendly, and it was a huge cup for just $4. 

$5 minimum for card.
author: Jenn W.

description: Besides their pricy items, they charge paying customers $2 to use their internet. Never coming here again.
author: Diego C.

description: Although the food is good (but very expensive), and the smoothies are great, the staff is very unhelpful. I was ordering while a phone call came in: someone had lost a bag and was calling to see if they had left it. The staff member who answered the phone responded simply said no had left anything with out even looking around. That is pretty par for course for the staff here. The layout of the place is very poor and clunky... it's fine for a cup of coffee or tea while reading or studying or chatting... but the service is rather poor and it's really expensive. But again, the food is tasty, large enough for splitting. And smoothies are good - the service is just rather poor.
author: Catherine H.

description: Came here once before; food is kinda pricey but decent. I got the B.L.A.T and it came with side of salad. Latte was decent, but not worth $6.
author: Ken H.

description: A healthy food and drinks option in lovely neighborhood. Perfect spot to come read or work and enjoy delicious drinks :)
author: Iryna P.

description:
Funny how everyone ends up at this place after Burma superstar... Not surprising as yo walkout from the food coma from such good food... You need coffee to cut the food... Luckily this coffee pace is in the best location, directly across the street as everyone heads over. The coffee was good and quick service but they charge extra $.75 for soy or almond milk and it's cash only!

Value 4/5
Atmosphere 3.5/5
Service 4/5
Quality 4/5

15.5/20
author: Nina S.

description: Nice little cozy corner spot. outdoor patio is always a win with me, coffee was not memorable but the cake was decently moist and the whole set up and ambiance was nice. some people were a bit too loud, more like bar flys that overstayed their welcome for the free wifi but nonetheless an affordable cute little place
author: Kalina P.

description: Paid two dollars for two hours of wi-fi. Connection was very poor. Don't use this place for meetings if strong wi-fi is essential for a presentation.
author: Aaron O.

description: I love this spot -- great for relaxing (unless you decide to go on the weekend, then it's a mad house). Because they make some things from scratch (the Mexican hot chocolate for example), sometimes it can take you upwards of 15 minutes to get your order.
author: Mima G.

description:
Once in a while, I'll order an espresso, this is one of those places that I like to sit and savor it, outdoor facing Clement Street.  There is also a dynamic variety of beautiful women who jogs in this area.  Some even jogs with just a two piece speedo set.  It certainly brings out a peek of great interest.  I would imagine it is great for exercising the eyes! QQ

They remolded the windows so they now fully open all the way.  On a nice day in the Richmond district, this is heaven.  This was one of my old hangout years ago.  It was just down the hill from USF.  It is probably one of the few surviving coffee shops in this area that is still in business.  Seating arrangement can be tight during busy hours so if you don't like sharing space in tight quarters with strangers, this will not work for you.  I do recommend trying their signature Mexican hot chocolate.  It's quite delicious and will put a smile on your face!

PROS
--free wifi
--outdoor seating (great on a nice day)
--serve breakfast and sandwiches
--serve fruit drinks/smoothies
--great for exercising the eyes QQ
CONS
--tight space, cramp
--could have more selections of pastries
author: Edwin R.

description: Great menu -creative, delicious, healthy right on point' the service is sweet and slow, great for the mellow type. I will say I didn't think the espresso was that high-grade, still very much enjoyed their juices -watermelon and ginger with some carrot...yup!
author: Thurston T.

description: Great neighborhood coffee spot. Good coffee, wonderful kombucha on tap, as well as excellent craft beer available.  Cute space with eclectic crowd. Nice sidewalk seating as well. Did not try the food, but looked delicious. So happy this spot is in our hood.
author: Brooke S.

description: I don't understand this place. The food and drinks are very average and ridiculously overpriced. You also have to PAY TO USE WIFI. With that said, this place attracts pretentious hipsters. Seriously, skip this place. Clement street has so much else to offer. You can get an honest, tasty meal anywhere else. Also, if you agree that it's absurd to pay for wifi in a cafe, go across the street to Quickly's (it's free).
author: christina tam n.

description:
THEY CHARGE FOR WIFI. Came with a freind, they charged $2 for wifi. The code only works on 1 device...

We paid 12$ and realized we could not stay here. Would not recommend this place.
author: M C.

description:
CHEAPSKATES!!!

I never leave yelp reviews, but my experience with this place has been really disappointing!

They charge $2/hour to use their wifi.  Fine.  I respect a coffee shop that wants to be more than a co-working place these days.  But the employees are really rude about it.

When my internet went down I needed a spot to get online and finish a project. They charged me $2 and wanted to charge another $2 to connect my phone as well.  (And the internet is very slow).

A little love goes a long way.  If I wasn't in a tough spot, I wouldn't be asking for help.  But these guys just want to get that $$$.

There are much friendlier places in this neighborhood to spend your bucks.
author: Jacob P.

description:
50 minutes for a fucking sandwich. Yea, alot of you reading this will find that shocking. You got your order on time so what do you care? You don't. This place is cool in your book. This review isn't gonna change your mind so keep going there. You're gonna be satisfied, you're gonna love the ambience and have a great time - but just know that while you suck down that smoothie and sip on your latte, there's someone like me waiting for their fucking sandwich for 50 fucking minutes. I'm not even joking about that time too; it was 1:05p.m. when i ordered and 1:55p.m. when they gave it to me in a box so the workers don't have to deal with me anymore. 

You guys working that day probably thought you smoothed things out by finally getting me my sandwich, but wait till your boss reads this review. If you're the owner of Blue Danube Cafe, the guy taking orders at the counter was a pony-tailed latino dude, one waitress was a short asian, and another waitress was a chubby latino girl. All your employees were to blame for this fuck-up. Not one of them stepped-in and assured me my order was on it's way. Not one. I actually had to get-up and tell Mr.Ponytail about waiting after 30 minutes. Still, even after another 20 minutes, orders were heading out to the other patrons leaving me going; "what the fucking fuck man?!". Shouldn't my order take precedence now? Mr.Ponytail, how nice of you to actually get your ass into the kitchen and make the sandwitch yourself in front of the kitchen staff.

Not even a fucking courtesy refund. 50 minutes you incompetent dummies. 50 minutes. Seriously, I wouldn't be surprised if you idiots let this kinda shit happen all the fucking time. No-one is calling you out of this crap in politically correct San francisco. Take this review as a fucking wake-up call. Learn how to run a buisness you retards. Also, the sandwich was delicious!!
author: Razmig M.

description: I loved the Blue Danube and was devastated when they closed for several months, but charging for wifi? What, is this 2003? I don't think I'll be visiting very often. Where is the new cozy coffee shop with good food in the Inner Richmond where I can nibble and drink while I work? Halp.
author: Michelle L.

description: Cool atmosphere but that's it. The first time I came here I got a salad- the chicken was like rubber and there was a hair in it!! I've tried multiple times to like this place because it's by my house but I've been disappointed every time. The prices are way too high, the food is terrible, there's such little space- everything is crammed in, and THEY CHARGE YOU TO USE THEIR WIFI even if you buy something.....
author: Jessie A.

description:
Stopped in here to grab some drinks while on the wait list for Burma Superstar.
Good menu selection of coffee drinks, smoothies, and fruit juices, with some light food options thrown in for good measure: salads, sandwiches, hummus plate, pita chips, a few small cookies and munchable things in the pastry case. 

Service was just okay. Cashier had a bit of attitude, but folks bringing food out and clearing tables were sweet. 

Got the funky monkey smoothie (banana, peanut butter, chocolate), the jolly rancher fruit juice (apple and watermelon mix), and a cappuccino. All were fairly good, if we hadn't been on our way to lunch I would have explored some of the healthy menu options.

Interior was pretty cool. A little too hippie for me, but loved the local-indie vibe of the place, and the art on the walls was nice. Mismatched tables, chairs, and couches was comfortable, and there were a lot of folks with laptops. But the tables were all sticky and dirty, prices were  bit high for my liking ($5/drink avg), and again, cashier seemed to have a bit of an attitude.

Surprised to see so many laptops out- not sure how anyone was getting work done, since the music was really loud. Felt like our group was a little on the loud side to have conversation and hear one another.
author: Stefany V.

description:
Great neighborhood coffee shop! Quirky, cozy, intimate. I would frequent this place if I lived in the area.

Get the mocha mint- basically tastes like a peppermint mocha from starbucks but better!
author: Vivian D.

description:
Pros: Tasty food, drinks, and cool seating area.
Cons: Cash ONLY, over priced for my liking (given the category)

I ordered their chicken sandwich, which was delicious, but the only problem for me was the price. I ended up paying just under $10 for a sandwich that wouldn't satisfy my appetite. I'm a bit torn because while the sandwich wasn't as big as I would've liked, it comes with a salad. Personally, I'd rather have a bigger sandwich than a side salad, but at least it forces me to eat more vegetables haha.

I pondered their juices and smoothies menu, seemed like more of a fair pricing structure, given that they supposedly used organic ingredients and Jamba Juice (bleh) is more expensive.

I hate to knock a small business on pricing, I understand they're a small business, which I like to support. Thankfully, the sandwich was good and it seems like a cool spot to chill over lunch. Had it not be for those pros, this place wouldn't be receiving my business. SUPPORT SMALL BUSINESS!
author: Aaron C.

description:
I passed by this place and decided to check its reviews before stepping in. It had good ratings, comments, pictures, etc. However when I approached the people working there, I didn't find them to be particularly friendly; they were helpful though.

I ordered a B.L.A.T on baguette and my company chose a roast beef sandwich. When we got the food I noticed that the bread was wrong so I went up to the counter to make sure. Asked what type of bread was used, he said "you ordered a baguette right?" And i said yes. He looked over the counter at my table and said "no wait. You ordered a regular". It was odd since we both just confirmed I didn't. After some thought he offered to make another one; but no one likes to waste so I was appreciative of the gesture, but declined.

It was good anyway! Sandwich was kind of light though for $9. Large looking but very thin; mostly bread since it was a Bacon Lettuce Avocado Tomato.
I didn't like the roast beef so much. It had a strong mustard taste.

Besides that, I really liked the setting of the venue. Very cozy looking; though, not sure if I'd come back.
author: Lisa D.

description: This place exudes that old city charm. They have coffee, smoothies, and even beers. The baristas are friendly and welcoming.
author: t l.

description:
This is my original coffee spot pre-living in SF days

Foods great, smoothies, salads, etc

Great strong coffee

Good atmosphere

Love the Richmond

If only more coffee shops could be this way

Love how it's so open and airy

Have some great memories of days there when it actually rained in Calfornia
author: Alanna F.

description:
Considering the fact that I grew up in the heart of Silicon Valley, you would think theee would be more independent coffee shops, but alas there are more chain coffee stores. This has got to be one of the most quaint and unique coffee place I have been to in a long time AND the coffee is awesome. Personal advocate of anythi g mint and chocolate, so try their Mocha Mint (I got a double). Their cup sleeve is a Häagen-Dazs coupon! 

I don't come down this way often, I was actually looking for another coffee place and ended up here. I'm only down this way to go to St. Ignatius for a Wedding Rehearsal. The decor goes with the unique-ness of the neighborhood, and definitely is a hidden gem in this part. You have to be in the know, about this place. simple outdoor seating with a bench and couple chairs and tables. Small interior room with several seati g choices and plugs for laptops and chargers. They have a small food menu. Definitely will come back if I end up in the Inner Richmond again.
author: Jenny D.

description:
This place has a lot to offer. There's a full food menu with lots of sandwiches to choose from. 

I personally opted for the Strawberry Bliss (strawberry banana smoothie). It was very good!

Some things I didn't like:
--This place gets really cramped on weekends. There is really no way to get around. I have to deal with that feeling enough on San Francisco streets. I just want to enjoy my smoothie in peace.

--It's cash only, dudes. Had to hit up my friend for money. Made me look like a chump.
author: Sam D.

description:
I don't understand why this place gets such good reviews. I have been there with friends several time and its just an average cafe. 

Expensive cups of coffee and the sandwiches are mediocre at best. I do like their Mexican hot chocolate though. 

Cash only and you have to pay for wifi. Also, it gets loud there when the place fills up.
author: Alfred L.

description:
I was in the area early in the morning and it was the only spot open with food. 
The environment is ok, maybe a tad hipstery.
Heres is the rundown:
Sandwich was overpriced and small.  Though they did give a small side salad with it.  The sandwich was pretty bland and needed more sauce, which after being added made it palatable.  The salad was rather plain but still decently good.  Not a terrible deal.
They wanted $2 for the wifi which is kind of scummy to do to a customer.

This place gets a solid 'OK' in my book.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Nice place. Had steamed egg with bacon tomatoes cucumbers and the Danube salad. Came with some fruit. 

Wouldn't mind a omelet from this place if they change their menu...no complaints. Would probably come here again. Cash ONLY! Yikes...
author: Thomas C.

description:
good food, good coffee!
wifi 2$ with abysmal speeds,  less than 0.5mbps, not a place to hang out with your laptop.
author: Yasser A.

description:
Had a nice time at blue danube cafe 
got the beets arugula salad with sun dried tomatoes and dried figs - requested no feta and hubby ate my side of warm bread. the salad was wonderful. 

Also had a GF brownie - on the sweeter side but still hit the spot - sorghum flour chickpea flour and rice flour. 

and a mighty leaf vanilla tea hit the spot

nice friendly service and ambiance  to read a book. 

I will be back!
author: Win H.

description: Last time I was there the windows were kept wide open despite cold weather outside. Is that still the case? If so, I avoid. I like to be comfortable where I eat.
author: Barry G.

description:
The scene goes like this...

I'm sitting on a couch, charging my faithless i-device which was this close to death.

Next to me is a cute Latina chick studying for her Dentistry exams.  To my right is a guy who just arrived via skate board, and he is busting out an ominous wooden mask.  He's carving the thing by hand, incredibly.  Nearby there's an old guy chatting, having some food, and writing poetry.  Straight across the room there is a couple seriously hot and heavy.  Their lips are locked in the longest sultriest kiss I've ever seen in a coffeeshop.  There are couches here and there, and 60's rock tunes playing.  

Some colorful folk are sitting at the sidewalk tables chatting, and a huge group of bicycles just drove by.  One of them had a stereo system and they all seem to be enjoying the Tuesday SF night air.

All I can say is I am glad I took this detour today!

PS: ORder the mate tea, it's off the chain.   Wifi is $2 and worth every penny.
author: Sean S.

description:
SF chilly Autumn nights call for warm drinks so my boyfriend and I came to Blue Danube on a Friday night at around 9pm to find just that. Blue Danube has a variety of drinks to choose from, but we ended up getting the Mexican Hot Chocolate. The barista asked us if we wanted marshmallows and whipped cream with that.. um yes please! I also got a black and white which was basically a milk chocolate and white chocolate covered shortbread cookie.

Mexican Hot Chocolate - Yum! This was EXACTLY what I was looking for. The Mexican Hot Chocolate was not too sweet, smooth, and so creamy! The best part? It came in a HUGE mug, which took me a while to finish. 

As if the eclectic decor and great drinks didn't impress me, Blue Danube also has great playing music in the background. :) I highly recommend!
author: Joyce E.

description: If you want coffee with your milk this is the place to come.  Bland, luke warm cup of coffee flavored milk. Two star as oppose to one because it was a sunny day so I was in at least somewhat good mood.
author: Mr C.

description:
Am I the only one who thinks this place would be a helluva lot better if they seemed to care? I got the lox bagel, and for $8 I would expect there to be a decent amount of fresh lox, and for the bagel to be discernibly toasted (maybe a little crunch?). It was neither - previously frozen lox and a bagel that was borderline chewy.

But my biggest gripe is the customer service - the guy at the register gives you the impression that he simply cannot wait for you to be out of his face. It would be fine if the stellar food somehow made up for it, but as mentioned above, it doesn't. The fruit that came with the American wrap was four pieces of cantaloupe and four grapes, and again, wouldn't have been a big deal had the wrap been amazing.

I've come to Blue Danube a half dozen times over the last four years, and each time I've been left underwhelmed. As an Inner Richmond devotee, it would be great to have a spot as warm and cheerful as this with great service and passable food, but we were left with a very 'meh' feeling. We could have made better food at home.
author: Katie H.

description:
I love their Hulk Smoothie and the ambiance. I have returned many times for both. Decorated with great artwork and the customers (usually regulars) are respectful of the atmosphere. I also had a great panini here a while back that had figs and arugula and cheese if I remember correctly. I still think about that panini and it's been over a year!

That said I have a few bones to pick with this place. For one, I am not a fan of businesses being cash only. And sometimes the service leaves a little to be desired.

My biggest complaint though is that they charge for wifi. Maybe I'm a bit entitled about this, but I have come to expect wifi from a coffee shop. I get what they are going for -- many of the customers that hang out here are avid literary consumers or writers or are there to engage in conversation with friends. They push beyond the stereotypical coffee shop with a bunch of tables full of macbook pros. Being right down the street from Green Apple, I get it. And, I know it's hard to provide wifi because then you have customers that purchase one item and hang out there for hours taking up space.

Mostly I'm just aggravated because I love the atmosphere and I wish I could do work here but on principle I just won't pay for the wifi.

Also, I think prices are a little too high. But hey, that's the SF lifestyle for ya.
author: Laura C.

description: The latte is good. The tables are all smashed together causing an uncomfortable space. And $2 for 2 hours of slow wifi? That is absolutely ridiculous.
author: Jimmy J.

description:
This place has a nice relaxed atmosphere. We dropped in to have some Brie and wine and a little conversation. The cheese platter was quite delightful with Brie, apples, blackberries, and grapes. 

We also tried the hummus platter who've included sliced tomatoes and cucumbers with the hummus and pita.

All our food was fresh and served quickly. It was nice to sit outside while people watching and enjoying our snack.
author: Topher W.

description: I couldn't contain my happiness at this coffee shop being open again! I feel I came here three times a week to read, grade papers, or just relax. Great decor, great food and coffee, and the staff is excellent. My only regret about this place was it was closed over a year as I depart the city for Santa Cruz. But every time I am back home in the Inner Rich and am in need of some coffee and a place to chill, this is my spot. WELCOME BACK BLUE DANUBE!!!!!
author: Alistair R.

description: The egg and cheese croissant was delicious. I ordered it wihout ham, and still got ham in it, but I still ate it.
author: Adrianna S.

description:
Love everything about this place! 
The ambiance, the food, the crowd, the service! 
I can most definitely recommend the spinach quiche + mimosas! The quiche has a pie like crust, thick fluffy egg / spinach/ cheese mix concoction! YUM MM! And how can you go wrong with mimosas? You can't! They give you a wine glass filled to the tippy top with oj/ bubbly + give you the rest of the bottle to finish it off! The sweets are always delish + fresh! 
*** CASH ONLY!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Morning started off great as the ambiance of this place is relaxing and calm in the early AM.  After I finished my coffee date I planned on sticking around to work, however after sitting there trying to connect to wi-fi I found out that they CHARGE to connect ($2/2hr).  I haven't heard of having to pay for wi-fi at shops in a long time.  Perhaps, free with purchase (and some sort of limit imposed) would be the reasonable thing to do.

Sorry Blue Danube, I wanted you to be my local shop but charging for wi-fi is a big flaw especially after spending $4 on a cappuccino.  Next time, if there's a next time I'll have my wi-fi hot spot on me ha.
author: Christopher W.

description: Great to see this place reopen again. This place was my hangout in high school and it hasn't lost its flavor at all despite new owners. Good coffee good food, funky friendly atmosphere. Reminds me so much of simple pleasures out on Balboa , another hang out spot. Thank god for the small coffee shops
author: Matt A.

description:
I really want to like this place, but I usually end up wishing I'd gone somewhere else. I'm pretty mellow about my coffee, but I was a barista, so I know when something is good. The coffee here is very good. The food, service and space are less awesome. 

Price: 4 stars, reasonable for the quality
Ambiance: 2 stars, not the mellow, unassuming space I'm looking for. It's a space trying very hard to be interesting. You know those, like, TGIFridays sorts of places? Where they have all the shit up on the walls? This is the coffee shop version of that.
Service: 2 stars, they get the stars because they DO make a good coffee beverage. On the one hand, you'll never have to ask for extra contempt with your drink, but alt least they're slow. 
Food: 3 stars, the coffee is really good but the food isn't.
author: Thomas K.

description:
14-02-16

Food .................................. 3 1/2
Cleanliness ........................ 1 1/2 - 2
Service .............................. 3



Warning ... charge WiFi usage

Used to be one of my favorite coffeehouse place need serious full cleaning

U could smell rotten smell like spills or food residue rotting near the window area

Used to be 4 stars for me ...

Don't wanna write a bad review ... this is note to the owner to bring it back to 
      it's original glory.

Good selection of food at reasonable price

Clean EVERYTHING! Don't keep the rug ... hardwood is easier to clean & healthier
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Overall a cute quaint place to go have a cup of coffee, latte or hot chocolate. And has a variety of breakfast foods on the menu along with baked goods and pies to choose from.

As soon as you walk in you notice that there is a good ambiance and the table/ seating set-up is very welcoming. *note: If you are there on a beautiful sunny Sunday morning for brunch, try to wait for a table outside. The Clement St. area is changing slowly, for the better! This place has been here for years but I remember growing up and I never seemed to care for coffee so we would just pass by. 
But anyway, come in or sit outside for brunch! 

I gave it four stars overall for the ambiance, coffee and the French toast was good. 
I want to see what else is on the menu since I've been here about three times, today I just soaked in the cafe vibe. 
Goodvibes SF people :)
author: Ruth Awit S.

description:
I have a long history with the Blue Danube.  I've been coming here on and off since 2006. I'm old. Old and sad. 

The cafe is a great place to lounge in, hang out with friends, read a book, or get some work done. 

They have beer and wine, which is a nice plus. Also, it can fill up fast so have a plan B, just in case. 

My gal pal thought the bathroom was dirty. So there's that. (I hate that saying.) (So there's that.) (Sometimes, I hate myself.) (So there's also that.) (Maybe I'll start using parenthesis around all my sentences.) 

All I can say is that it's a public bathroom. Sometimes it's clean and sometimes it's not so clean. You could do worse. (Stephen King likes that saying.) (Bring a condom.)
author: Sethy Wethy ..

description:
Drinks or just okay but I can't help but love this little gypsy cove. 

A place like this is such a wonderful surprise for Clement street. My aunt took me here because she loved their chai and mexican hot chocolate. I thought everything was just okay. From the mismatched pillows to the tiny tables. I love this cozy little book of a place. Definitely will come back to do some reading and have some coffee dates.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Have been meaning to try this place for awhile now, but never got around to trying it! Would have to give this place a 3.5 rating. 

Came in for lunch last week with a friend and ordered a good amount of food, wanting to try a lot. 

I got a tuna sandwich and my friend got a roast beef sandwich, both were really fresh and good. 

We also got watermelon juice ( egh it was okay) and the mint mocha ( thought it would taste completely different) also not my favorite drink, maybe because of the mix of coffee flavor with mint. 

For dessert we tried the French toast which was completely dry... I would say that there was just to much bread stacked on top of one another and it was bland, not even crispy. 

Overall not bad place for sandwiches and breakfast food.
author: Julia K.

description: Great coffee and smoothies. The americano is perfect strong and slightly sweet add a touch of brown sugar and I'm ready to take on the day. The boyfriend usually gets a smoothy, mango is his fav. We got the classic breakfast bagel sammich last time and split it. Totally hit the spot, a everything bagel topped with fluffy scramble eggs, melted cheddar cheese and crisp bacon, loved it. Keep things simple and good. This might become a regular morning stop when I visit my BF in the bay.
author: Allison Y.

description:
I have to thank Burma Superstar for finding this cafe. Situated just across from the restaurants, I hopped across to wait for my table. That was the first time. Second time I came all the way just to have their coffee. 

To cut a long story short they have one of the best soy lattes in the world. So creamy to a point where you think is this dessert? Or is it coffee? Absloutly worth the journey. They have a good selection of hot chocolates and coffees too but I really can't bring myself to try anything else. 

The establishment itself is a little run down and looks like a cafe on Campus. Having said you may love the casual polynesian feel to the place. You order and pay at the counter and then collect your coffee yourself, so don't expect a full service. The coffee can be a little slow but seriously seriously worth the wait.
author: Nora B.

description: I used to live right around the corner and would come here every so often. They have great teas and coffees and the shop itself is cozy and quaint. I love writing in their store journals and drawing pictures--it makes it fun and interesting to read what other people write. Parking can be a bummer, but Clement Street is always a little nuts. Now that I don't live in the area, I seem to come here when I'm in town visiting. Probably more for nostalgia than anything.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Minimal amount of lox on a $8 bagel and lox isn't acceptable. Ok atmosphere though. Also, aid for French toast. When it wasn't available and I retested the lox instead I wasn't offered the cash difference. It's only $1 but I hate feeling nickel and dimed.
author: Max C.

description:
(+): coffee cake

(-): expensive, shitty service, they charge you 2$ extra for wifi, they overcharged me for an iced coffee, and the guy couldn't have cut me a smaller piece of their delicious ass coffee cake.  

(0): I'll admit I'm not in a great mood but this place's negatives would have gotten a bad review from me anyway
author: Siva M.

description: Love the atmosphere. When you're on the Burma Super Star waiting list, this is a welcome refuge from the hoards of people waiting outside. Try the pumpkin chocolate chip cake.
author: Andy J.

description: I was around the area and decided to stop by for a cup of coffee while I filled out an application.  It's a cute, quirky, little coffee shop.  I liked the atmosphere because it was somewhat intimate. Anyways, I got the mint mocha and it was just okay.  I wasn't highly impressed because I couldn't taste the mint at all.  Maybe I'll stop by next time I'm in the area and try out their breakfast menu because damn, that French toast looked good.
author: Kenitha Y.

description:
I'm a fan of cold brewed coffee. And they make it quite nice here.

Their breakfast sandwiches are good. Kinda pricey though. 

Nice outdoor seating. And they serve you. 


Parking can be a pain.. depending in the day and time you're there.
author: Lisa Marie N.

description:
With funk and jazz music playing in the background, this cafe has all the right ambiance to be a special place. There is a small TV by the door showing soccer with many nicely framed artwork and mirrors all around the walls. This place gets a lot of natural sunlight from its large opened windows, and the old wooden decor gives this mom and pop the layout that embodies the spirit of San Francisco. 

Sitting here doing some work for the last few hours has been a blast. There's a lot of foot traffic to allow for people watching while those who remain are either reading or waiting for their name to be called at Burma SuperStar. My soy Americano ($2.35) gave me a nice jolt while the background music made it easy to keep motivated on my writing, including this review. Haha...

Service is friendly and responsive. Although they do provide wifi service it is unfortunately not free ($4 whole day). 4.5 stars for a great cafe with lots of character and very cool ambiance.
author: Daniel L.

description:
There are only a couple of things I really want from a coffee shop. One of those is good coffee, and Blue Danube has that (but then, so do literally hundreds of other places in San Francisco). I also want a good atmosphere, and Blue Danube has that (but so do hundreds of other places in San Francisco). I want polite, efficient staff, and Blue Danube has that (but so do hundreds of other places in San Francisco). 

But the single thing I most want -- the consideration that trumps literally everything else -- is that if I get a cup of coffee to go, I want the lid to fit tightly enough onto the cup that they effectively restrict the coffee from exiting the cup/lid combination anywhere other than through the designated drinking hole, so that the cup/lid combination is essentially a single object THAT DOESN'T LEAK ALL THE FUCK OVER YOUR SHIRT WHILE YOU'RE DRIVING AND TRYING TO DRINK IT. This is the single most important factor that 95% of the coffeehouses I've ever been to get right EVERY SINGLE TIME I visit them, and this is of course the area in which Blue Danube failed the one and only time I tried to get coffee there. In fact, their lid leaked faster and harder than basically any other defective lid I've ever dealt with at any other coffee shop ever. I must have lost a good 15% of my drink onto my necktie, which I failed to notice until the drink was maybe 2/3 gone because my necktie, you know, doesn't have any nerve endings in it, and can't tell me when coffee is leaking on it while I'm driving.

So, yeah, pretty good coffee. Pretty good baked goods. Nice atmosphere.
